newsitem.title: ALBANIA: Albania upholds jail terms on four communists.
newsitem.headline: Albania upholds jail terms on four communists.

text.p: Albania's appeal court on Wednesday upheld jail sentences on four Albanians who formed a communist party, breaching the constitution of the Balkan state, once a bastion of hardline communism.

The four men, aged between 45 and 73 years, were jailed for between one and two and half years. They pleaded guilty to charges of forming a communist party but appealed against the length of the sentences on grounds of old age and alleged irregularities during the investigation.
"The court decided to uphold the verdict of the Tirana (district) court," appeals judge Lefter Jahja said, reading out the brief verdict.
The court had ruled that the men aimed to take power in Albania and overthrow the nation's constitutional order.

After the demise of Albania's communist dictatorship in 1990, the country introduced a series of laws to punish former leaders and prevent a resurgence of communism. Parliament outlawed all communist organisations in July 1992.
